content.question: The speed of a runner, in miles per hour, on a straight trail is modeled by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>m</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>m</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>9</mn> <msup> <mi>m</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>12</mn> <mi>m</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> </math>, where m is the runner’s distance, in miles, from the start of the trail. What is the maximum speed of the runner for 0 ≤ m ≤ 3 ?

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
